com.oculusinfo.geometry.geodesic

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.oculusinfo.geometry.geodesic.Position
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Position
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A class to describe (and allow math upon) a position on the earth TODO: All calculations internally (except conversion) are still using geodetic algorithms; they need to pay attention to the calculation parameters.
    Author:
    Nathan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Position(double longitude, double latitude)
      Create an object that represents a position on the surface of the Earth using standard latitude and longitude.
      Position(double longitude, double latitude, double elevation)
      Create an object that represents a position on the surface of the Earth using standard latitude, longitude, and elevation.
      Position(double x, double y, double z, boolean ignoreElevation)
      Create an object that represents a position on the surface of the Earth, using cartesian coordinates with the Y axis being the axis of rotation, the XZ plane being the equator, with the Z axis pointed towards the Greenwich meridian.
      Position(Position oldForm, boolean polar)
      Copy a position, possibly changing from polar to cartesian or vice versa

    • Constructor Detail

      • Position

        public Position(double longitude,
        double latitude)
        Create an object that represents a position on the surface of the Earth using standard latitude and longitude. The resultant position will ignore elevation.
        Parameters:
        longitude - The longitude of the position, in degrees
        latitude - The latitude of the position, in degrees

      • Position

        public Position(double longitude,
        double latitude,
        double elevation)
        Create an object that represents a position on the surface of the Earth using standard latitude, longitude, and elevation.
        Parameters:
        longitude - The longitude of the position, in degrees
        latitude - The latitude of the position, in degrees
        elevation - The elevation of the position, in meters above sea level

      • Position

        public Position(double x,
        double y,
        double z,
        boolean ignoreElevation)
        Create an object that represents a position on the surface of the Earth, using cartesian coordinates with the Y axis being the axis of rotation, the XZ plane being the equator, with the Z axis pointed towards the Greenwich meridian.
        Parameters:
        x - The coordinate in the direction of (0 deg N, 90 deg E)
        y - The coordinate in the direction of the north pole
        z - The coordinate in the direction of (0 deg N, 0 deg E)
        ignoreElevation - if true, sets calculations using this position to ignore any elevation inherent in the position; if false, elevation will be taken into account

      • Position

        public Position(Position oldForm,
        boolean polar)
        Copy a position, possibly changing from polar to cartesian or vice versa
        Parameters:
        oldForm - The position being copied
        polar - True if the new position should be in polar coordinates, false if it should be in cartesian coordinates.

        public double getElevation()
        Gets the elevation of this position.
        Returns:
        The elevation of this position in meters
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this position doesn't specify an elevation.

      • getAzimuth

        public double getAzimuth(Position p)
        Gets the angle from this point to the other.
        Parameters:
        p - The other point.
        Returns:
        The angle from this to p, in degree, with north=0, east=90

      • offset

        public Position offset(double azimuthDegrees,
              double distanceDegrees)
        Get the point offset from this point by the given distance at the given azimuth.
        Parameters:
        azimuth - The angle, in degree, with N=0, E=90, in which the desired offset point lies
        distance - The angular distance, in degrees, by which to offset this point.
        Returns:
        The point offset from this one as described.

      • greatCircleAtLatitude

        public static Position greatCircleAtLatitude(Position p1,
                             Position p2,
                             double latitude)
        Get the point on the great circle from a to b at the given latitude
        Parameters:
        a - The segment start point
        b - The segment end point
        latitude - The latitude of the desired result (in degrees)
        Returns:
        A point on the great circle between A and B at the given latitude, or null if the shortest-path segment of the great circle from a to b doesn't intersect that latitude. If the given latitude is intersected multiple times, the first is returned.
